thread.title: Man United transfer news: Bordeaux striker Malcolm speaks out on interest | Metro News
thread.title_full: Man United transfer news: Bordeaux striker Malcolm speaks out on interest | Metro News

author: Sean Kearns For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Man United transfer news: Bordeaux striker Malcolm speaks out on interest | Metro News

organizations.name: metro news sean kearns for metro.co.uk

text:
Sean Kearns for Metro.co.uk Monday 20 Feb 2017 4:00 pm Bordeaux ace Malcom is a wanted man (Picture: Getty) 
Bordeaux striker Malcom insists he’s not held talks with either Liverpool or Manchester United despite interest from the Premier League clubs. 
The Brazilian forward joined Bordeaux from Corinthians in a £5m deal last January and has six goals in 30 appearances for the Ligue 1 side. Theo Walcott left red-faced as Arsenal fans slam club for 'disrespectful' gesture 
Speculation in Malcom’s native Brazil linked the forward to both Manchester United and Liverpool this week after his impressive performances this term. 
However, the 19-year-old insists he knows nothing about the interest and wants to focus on life in France. 
‘This thing about Liverpool (and) Manchester – I don’t know anything about it,’ said Malcom. 
‘I’m very calm, I only think about Bordeaux today. I want to do my job well and give French fans lots of joy. 
‘I got to know, yeah, that Sampaoli (Sevilla boss) likes my football, my game style. If the opportunity shows up, I’ll be happy. If it doesn’t, I’ll keep working hard, humble as always.’
